description: Trained Current Employees and Interns on How to use several IBMs Bluemix Cloud services
Designed a skeleton Mobile Application & API to work with Bluemix Cloud Services (Node.js . Sinatra - Ruby . Worklight)
Created the frontend of a web application which guides the user to setup the structure of his website
Developed Javascript Plugins to be used in the development cycle

projects.name: Verilog Web IDE/Simulator
projects.description: Experimental Verilog Web Editor and simulator divided into three main modules; the core module written in python and communicates with the api module (written in Node.js) through a message queue server which communicates with the frontend module (constructed with backbone.js)

projects.name: Quine McCluskey Circuit Drawer
projects.description: Given the terms of the boolean function, minimizes the boolean function and draws the circuit.

projects.name: Cache Simulator
projects.description: Simulates User Defined Types of Caches and automatically presents live Graphs.

projects.name: MIPS Disassembler/Simulator
projects.description: Disassembles Binary MIPS files and Simulates The Product.

projects.name: Linux CLI OS
projects.description: Built and assembled a linux OS from source using existing open source packages (kernel, awk, glibc ... etc) without using existing Linux Distros.

projects.name: Comic Hunter
projects.description: Scrapes Popular web comic series like xkcd, cyanide & happiness and the oatmeal.

projects.name: Big Data Analysis
projects.description: Using a Local installation of Hadoop and Pig analysed some properties of an approximately 375 GB of data and plotted it using R.

projects.name: Digit Recognizer
projects.description: Using existing training datasets and K-Nearest Neighbours Algorithm, trained a model to recognize a handwritten digit with an average precision of 0.94.

extracurricular-activities.description: Single Handedly Designed, Developed and Maintained The Student Unions Website
In a team of 3 people we designed, developed and maintained the CSEA website
